questions.question: Throughout the 24 hours of a day the Relative Humidity can be expected to:
options: a. increase during the day and decrease at night
b. stay reasonably constant throughout the 24 hours
c. reduce during the day and increase at night
d. only change with a change of air mass

questions.question: During a night with a clear sky, surface temperature will ______, RH will ______ and dew point will ______.
options: a. fall, rise, rise
b. rise, rise, fall
c. fall, rise, remain the same
d. fall, fall, remain the same

questions.question: A change of state directly from a solid to a vapour or vice versa is:
options: a. insolation
b. condensation
c. evaporation
d. sublimation

questions.question: The instrument used for measuring the humidity of air is a:
options: a. hydrometer
b. hygrometer
c. wet bulb thermometer
d. hygroscope

questions.question: The process of change of state from a gas to a liquid is:
options: a. evaporation in which latent heat is absorbed
b. evaporation in which latent heat is released
c. condensation in which latent heat is absorbed
d. condensation in which latent heat is released

questions.question: The process of change of state from a liquid to a gas is:
options: a. condensation in which latent heat is released
b. evaporation in which latent heat is released
c. condensation in which latent heat is absorbed
d. evaporation in which latent heat is absorbed

questions.question: Air is classified as dry or saturated according to its relative humidity. If the relative humidity were 95% the air would be classified as:
options: a. conditionally saturated
b. partially saturated
c. saturated
d. dry

questions.question: On a wet bulb thermometer in an unsaturated atmosphere there will be a reduction of temperature below that of the dry bulb thermometer because:
options: a. heat is absorbed during the process of condensation
b. heat is released during the process of condensation
c. heat is absorbed by the thermometer during the process of evaporation
d. heat is released from the thermometer during the process of evaporation

questions.question: Relative humidity is:
options: a. air temperature over wet bulb temperature 100
b. air temperature over dew point temperature 100
c. the actual amount of water vapour in a sample of air over the maximum amount of water vapour that the sample can contain x 100
d. the maximum amount of water vapour that a sample of air can contain over the actual amount of water vapour the sample does contain Ã— 100

questions.question: Absolute humidity is:
options: a. the number of water droplets in a given quantity of air
b. the amount of water vapour that a given quantity of air holds
c. the maximum amount of water vapour that a given quantity of air can hold
d. the maximum number of water droplets that a given quantity of air can hold

questions.question: Wet bulb temperature would normally be lower than the dry bulb temperature because:
options: a. condensation causes a release of latent heat
b. evaporation causes cooling
c. latent heat is absorbed by the bulb thermometer
d. of condensation on the muslin wick of the bulb

questions.question: The wet bulb temperature:
options: a. is measured using a hydrometer
b. is the minimum temperature to which a thermometer bulb can be cooled by the evaporation of water
c. measures the dew point of the air
d. is the minimum temperature reached by the surface of the earth as measured by a thermometer placed 1.2 metres above the ground

questions.question: Which one of the following statements relating to atmospheric humidity is correct?
options: a. If the air temperature falls then the absolute humidity must increase
b. The absolute humidity is the mass of water vapour contained in unit volume of air
c. The diurnal variation of dew point temperature is greatest when skies are clear at night
d. The dew point temperature is the temperature indicated by the wet bulb thermometer

questions.question: When condensation takes place, the higher the temperature, the ______ amount of latent heat ______.
options: a. lesser; released
b. greater; absorbed
c. greater; released
d. lesser; absorbed

questions.question: When water vapour changes to ice:
options: a. latent heat is absorbed
b. specific heat is released
c. latent heat is released
d. specific heat is absorbed
